alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 9:46PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek and Jordan Creek near Areas Around Montana Creek, Skaters Cabin Road, Mendenhall Campground, View Drive And Jordan Creek Mall. * WHEN...Until 400 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around Montana Creek, Skaters Cabin Road, Mendenhall campground, View Drive and Jordan Creek Mall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek and Jordan Creek. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 9:00pm the stage was 32.31 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. Impacts: At 32.0 feet: This is bankful conditions along Auke Lake. At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 9:00pm the stage was 9.23 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.67 feet is expected around 10:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 9.2 feet: This is the stage when Jordan Creek is at bankfull and water will begin to inundate areas along the edges of the creek near Race Reality and Jordan Square. At 9.7 feet: Water will inundate the Jordan Square`s front and back parking lots, around Jordan Creek office condominiums with up to one foot of water. Some residential driveways will be flooded and cut off. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 9:00pm the stage was 12.86 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 13.6 feet is expected around 4:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 14.5 feet: Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. Bankfull conditions at the gauge with water starting to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields along Mendenhall Loop Road. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 9:15pm the stage was 7.75 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 7.85 feet is expected around 4:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 6.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the "causeway" at the end of the trail. At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. Along the Mendenhall River some sections will experience bank erosion resulting in dangerous tree fall. These conditions could make floating the river more hazardous with the higher water levels. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
